item.title: The Sorcerer of the Wildeeps
item.description: Whoa. Masterful use of dialect and structure to deconstruct the traditional bounds of genre and narrative. The way the characters code-switch their way through multiple registers and languages—well-known and invented—is reflected in the way the novella flips through genres like a catalog, exposing the expectations and limitations of each.

item.title: A Taste of Honey
item.description: That ending! Talk about an ending that twists everything you thought you read for the previous 159 pages (I dare say, happily so).

item.title: There Will Be Phlogiston
item.description: Well fuck, now [[books/band sinister|Band Sinister]] has competition for most wholesome ever. So short, and so tender, so full of power and beauty.

item.title: The Price of Meat
item.description: Maybe don’t read this over lunch like I did? By which I mean, it’s fanfic of Sweeney Todd, it’s grisly horror, and it’s very good and effective, because KJ Charles.

item.title: The Rat-Catcher’s Daughter
item.description: Very sweet and dare I say necessary before [[books/gilded cage|Gilded Cage]]. It has some pretty key context. And come on—that title.

item.title: The Ruin of Gabriel Ashleigh
item.description: Why yes, I’m re-reading the whole series in order, even the miscellany. Probably my least favorite of the lot, but only due to how much I like the others.

item.title: Thornhedge
item.description: Aaaah the greenteeth! Toadling! A knight to the rescue that I don’t want to punch in the throat! But the GREENTEETH!

item.title: Three Kings
item.description: Another for my collection of killer opening lines: Ethan Shaw carried two knives, one for lilies, the other for veins.
